title: ICT Police nab five in Kirpa search operation
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 01 (APP):Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT) Police on Sunday conducted a search and combing operation in the jurisdiction of Kirpa Police Station, screening 60 individuals and arresting five suspects during the action.
An official told APP that the operation was part of the ongoing crackdown to curb crime and apprehend criminal elements in the federal capital.
He said that Islamabad Police teams conducted a grand search operation in different areas of Kirpa during which 27 houses, shops, and hotels were thoroughly searched, while 60 individuals and 30 vehicles were checked.
He said two suspicious individuals were also shifted to the police station for verification.
He said five accused were arrested during the operation, and police recovered a stolen motorbike, a weapon, and ammunition from their possession.
He said that such operations are being carried out under the special direction of DIG Islamabad Muhammad Jawad Tariq to tighten the noose around anti-social elements and enhance security across the city.
